reviews.review_msg: Han has a very nice personality. Course context itself is very inspiring and interesting.
Nice personality. Reads directly off of powerpoint slides. Did not cause me to think about materials. Portions of the material covered did not seem relative.

I was not at all impressed with her teaching style. She was inconsistent, disorganized, and all together useless. Coming to class was a pain - her teaching method definitely needs work. There were plenty of opportunities for interesting discussion or debate, but she always stopped short of anything productive.
She shows you many videos and clearly explains the questions students ask. I would take her class again : )
nice prof., very organized, lecture notes were straightforward, unfortunately there really is no need to attend the classes because everything that's on the tests are straight out of her powerpoints.
A very nice person, but it seemed that there's no point of attending the lectures because she only reads off the powerpoint... simply read the text and you'll be fine.
pretty good and easy course
Very hard to get a really high mark since the percentage for A's are really high
her exams fet harder and harder, pure memorization, hated it
Organized, efficient & tries hard to please
Brilliant professor,  in love with his skills such a great experience.

Clearly very passionate about linguistics, but this does lead him to ramble a bit, which can eat up some valuable lecture time. 3 midterms, no assignments, and no final exam. You will do better if you actually try to learn the material as best you can rather than just memorize it!

You'll definitely do well if you memorize both his midterm questions as well as his slides. Midterms are given so little time for that much question but as I said, as long as you memorize the whole thing you'll be fine.

Prof is sweet, but lectures can get long. It will be tough to pull through if you aren't that passionate about the course content, but overall easy to do well (GPA booster). Throughout the term you'll be working in groups which the assignments given aren't too difficult to complete. She's a good prof for ling.

I would definitely recommend taking this class. It's a super easy class and a good GPA booster. Assignments and quizzes were short and easy. She was very understanding considering the COVID circumstances and she was always gave clear criteria when doing classwork.
Very knowledgeable prof. Very thankful for the weekly discussions and open book quizzes, easy gpa booster. makes me want to take more linguistic courses! would recommend.

LING 100 Amazing Professor, she really tries to engage her audience. She is very approachable and takes her student's concerns seriously. Looking at the reviews of her, I could not disagree more. If you do your work and show up, you'll enjoy the class.
this is a sick class. No textbook needed but really boring but just take notes on her slides and u can get some dcent marks.  Dont buy the textbooks they screew u over

Good teacher, but impossible to change marks on an exam. she is very set in her answers and will not bend to consider someone else's thoughts or point of view. Note of advice for short answer questions: less is more, she doesnt like long answers.
Easy to pass but hard to get high grade.2 Mts and final. all have MC, true false qs, and short answer.she's a nice person but class is a bit boring.generally easy course nice prof.
No Comments
useless lecture, uesless course!  She got offended very often!  Always tell you not to memorize anything just to understand everything... and surely if you listen to her, you are gonna fail...!
very mean, careful in answering questions, not very helpful....dont have to go to lecture to pass her tests..she just follows the notes anyways..
worst marking scale ever
Too much assigned readings compared to others teaching the course, and horrible marking scale!
No Comments
She tries to please; however it is better off to read the notes and readings
She is very careful when she answers student's questions.tricky prof!
No Comments
No Comments
uesless lecture.....she can be really mean somtimes
No Comments
She is not very helpful when it comes to answering questions...

If you have good memory, the course will be a breeze. Her exams are fairly straight forward. However, an A+ is 96% and she does not curve. She stubbornly refuses to put up notes beforehand though, even when asked by students. She also has major, MAJOR issues with talking in class (who can blame them? Her way of presenting is boring).

Boringboringboring course. Took it as a GPA booster but this prof was so boring and bad at teaching that I skipped half the courses. She can't pronounce a lot of words, and mumbles, making her hard to understand. Students talk during class and a STUDENT HELPER/TA of hers emailed everyone asking us to stop... How sad.

2 MT + final. Study her lec notes. And read the text. Her lecs were ridiculous to go to since she was spilling word for word from the lec slides. Midterms were very doable. Not accumulative but final is. Final was a little brutal. She said 25% on old material & 75% on the stuff that was taught after MT2. But felt like 50/50 instead. Got an A-.
The class is a lot of memorization, but the professor is caring and makes time for students. Lectures can be dry, but studying with Unstuck study and the free textbook helps a lot.

I showed up to the first lecture and realized he read directly off his slides and talked about unnecessary things so I never attended another lecture. The class consisted of a midterm and then a end of semester midterm and I would say were pretty easy. The class is a lot of memorization though, you basically need to memorize all the slide content.

Hard exams, Long and confusing lectures that can be taught In very short amount of time. If you even provide evidence that why you were missing on Midterm, it's impossible to re do any of the tests. Your entire mark for this course is based on 3 midterms.

I really don't recommend this professor. Online lectures are 3 hours long and he often makes no sense at all which makes them pretty intolerable. Exams were 100+ multiple choice/short answer in approx an hour. I can't say it's difficult; just not worth your time. Three midterms make up your entire mark so one bad test ruins your mark. Not worth it.

Terrible. Talked about bees on a loop for 6 hours (2 full lectures). Will never, ever take again. I watched a girl open the exam booklet and cry. We had an hour to write a 90 question essay, no they were not all multiple choice

I personally really enjoyed his lectures. The subject matter is not very interesting, but he is really passionate and funny. It is a challenging course, you must go over the slides in depth and memorize the bolded stuff. Only 3 tests (30%,30%,40%), not cumulative. Like 80-90 MC questions and like 7-10 short answers, to do in 1 hour. Very intense.

pure memorization course. relatively easy course but the driest material. the prof is so boring and slow and its ironic that hes a linguist cause he cannot communicate clearly. his notes are super confusing. be ready to self teach. but if you are good at teaching yourself and basically just memorization the textbook you will be fine.

I took this course back in Spring of 2018. Iouri is a very caring and kind prof and makes a lot of time for his students if they need help with the class content after his lectures and during his office hours. His lectures can get a bit dry, as they often are 3 hours long, but he gives useful memorization tips for the content and is a solid choice.

lecture is boring exam is heavy strict rules in class. If u r using phone or labtop in class he will walk over to embrasse you. Time was short for exam and if didnt finish the sheets he wont allow you finsh it. Dont ever take his class . trust me.

Lots of reading, dry content, and your mark is comprised of 3 midterms worth 30, 30 and 40%. This is the worst professor I've ever had by far. Lectures move at a snail's pace, you can self-study the content in 1/3 the time. About 50% of his lectures are "background information" and personal stories but if you skip them you miss tiny details.
Easy class

Kind of a frustrating professor. Hard to understand, rambles a lot, his tests and lecture notes are formatted really strangely and hard to understand due to English not being his native language. He posts all his lecture notes and records his lectures, which is nice. You can tell he is really passionate about what he teachers, but it's quite boring

Says "guys" a lot. Sometimes adds in (partially related) stories - gives a few minutes of break time in addition to 20 minutes true break (for 3 hour lectures). Some words are not enunciated correctly - usually possible to guess which word he meant. Memorization heavy. Only true/false, short answer, multiple choice and fill-in-the-blanks.

Good class, good prof.  Provided you are respectful and do the reading, you'll do fine.  Prof is caring and understanding, but no fool.  Be sure to attend all classes, as all info is important for the midterms (those who don't generally do poorly).  Midterms are "dense", with many questions, so be well-prepared and budget your time carefully.
Yourie records his lectures, which helps with studying for his midterms. Midterms are noncumulative so they're easy to study for. This class is mainly memorization, so it's definitely a GPA booster

My total grade is 79.5%. The grade in his syllabus for 80%-85% is B+. Class average is 73.5%. I got 100/116 in the last midterm. The highest score is 104. But I still got B only. I did not think a 100 level course would be hard like this. And he is a boring teacher. He even want us to trust there is some super power.
Cute gentleman. Notes are very useful. You don't need to buy the book.
No need to go to class. Just read the notes and you'll be fine.

I stopped going to lecture after the first midterm. I quickly learned that you can do pretty good on the midterms without attending lecture or reading textbook. Lecture notes (he e-mails them) are sufficient. He is very confusing. Poor grammar, heavy accent.
I liked his teaching and his interest in the subject. Great prof. The lectures were very interesting.
Exams are easy, never showed up to class and got a B. Don't even have to read the course reader because he gives you a summary of the readings in his lecture notes.
Very funny professor - very enthusiastic about the topic. Definitely recommend him

He is the best prof i have ever had. I actually looked forward to his class because there were very informative and entertaining and i even grew an interst for linguistics. If your looking for a GPA booster take this class. All you have to do it attend lectures and pay attention in class and you'll get a minimum B-

a class that you should be able to get atleast a B. Test layouts are majority MC/TF/FIB and some short answer. I personally find the prof quite boring, make sure you write down the examples he give in class, cause those are 99% going to show up SOMEWHERE in the exam. notes are detailed but very vague, readings are recommended to fully understand hi

Study the notes and you will do well, for the notes are detailed and sufficient.  Should attend lectures because he gives out some notes that might be on exams. Prof. is at times funny and exams are fair. The readings are recommended to back up the notes but not necessary. Marking is fair as well. A  great gpa booster!

Funny prof. Has a very strong accent that's hard to understand. Sometimes he's misleading because he tells stories. In all, his notes are the best. No need to do readings or attend lectures (recorded). His notes are really detailed.
really entertaining prof, but he sort-of misleads when it comes to the midterms and final

Dr.Pankratz is very obviously dedicated to the subject of linguistics. His appreciation for the subject truly comes across in his impassioned lectures. He is easy to relate to, and reiterates important concepts. He genuinely cares about his students and understands that Linguistics is not just academic, but very practical in our everyday lives.

lectures are useless - everything is recorded - just listen to them online. the lecture notes (that he sends to students) doesnt really make sense. he is very very nice and tries hard to manage the class but i guess people taking it arent very respectful and there is a lot of chatting. midterms and finals aren't hard if you studied.

if you are a thinking but not a memorizing type of person, dont take it. and vice versa. his exams are easy if you memorize his notes and anything he tells you. exams will be hard if you wanna memorize all of them in a few days. it is lotsa lotsa stuff. classes are useless.

he's a great teacher. he cares about his students and posts significant and thorough resources for you to succeed. those who say he doesn't teach anything need to pay better attention and take better notes. his accent is a little hard to understand at first, but getting used to it isn't automatically really.
I like him. A great teacher and so helpful. He has a wonderful personality and passion for the subject. You rock Pank!

This is the best professor in the entire university! Material is interesting, prof is animated and interesting to listen to, exams are easy, just read his notes, and he's a real nice guy, like the father you wish you had!

You will definitely sleep in class. Some contents are quite interesting but he talks very dry.  His notes are not detailed at all. You basically have to count yourself in doing well in this course. His tests are not that long and is mostly lecture based rather than text based. If you nap in class you can always listen to the audio. He records.
He's a great professor, very engaging and he tries to help all his students. He has great stories and you can tell that he is very enthusiastic about the material. Plus the course is EASY!

AVOID! Hands down the WORST teacher I have ever had. Disorganized lectures, forgets his point, misunderstands student questions, drags on & on, goes off on unrelated tangents. Rude if you ask for help. It's an absolute chore to learn from his messy notes & lectures. Test format is confusing for no reason. Should not be teaching anyone, ever. AVOID!

Very very boring. The prof is nice but he doesn't know how to teach! The syllabus is confused! The exams are not hard but unfair! The prof always talks about something off-topic and pretends to be funny. This course is stupid! My friend cried because of the exam.

Really enjoys what he teaches.  Also, he takes the time to listen and discuss issues with students one and one, and really seems to care.  Lectures somewhat confusing, but he takes care to prepare really good notes.  Exams are really easy if you show up for class.
A very hard class not made any easier by the terribly confusing (although nice) Dr. Pankratz.
Avoid taking this class with Dr. Pankratz. He obviously loves what he teaches, however, for those not deeply interested in linguistics he is terribly confusing, unclear and his exams are dreadful!
boring lectures. okay prof in ling 100 but not 110. he didn't seem to know the materials well enough to teach ling 110
great prof. super nice. he knows what he's talking about and has passion for it. its an easy class, just know the notes. mostly common sense
lectures r boring,i didn't go to class after the 1st mt but still got a A-. just read his notes and required text then u'd do fine.
Took his course 2 yrs ago, his lectures were very intersting, funny, easy to understand, u just cant fall asleep in his class. A++++++ prof!!!!

he does ramble off topic, but his noises and calls in class were entertaining, lectures were boring, his accent is kinda heavy so listen carefully...just study the notes he gives us and u'll b fine...
Fairly easy...but boring in general......and he likes to produce the birds' calls...-__-0
Easiest course ever.. All you need is past exmas to do well.. Almost word by word.. I got an A because of it..  Make sure you get hold of his past exams before taking the course.
I find the lectures interesting. Exams are FAIR once you know where he gets his questions from. Grade A Prof!

Incredibly boring but super easy class. He is a great guy but does repeat himself too often in lecture.  Lecture notes and all online docs are all you need for this class. Quick on email, emails sample exams, etc.  Ling 100 content not interesting.

Not a bad prof. Often goes off topic, but as long as you do the readings, you'll be fine. His "student files" are unecessary, but they are very interesting to read. Tests are easy, but his "circle the WRONG answer" thing is pretty conf

His passion for the subject really helped me enjoy the class.He was quick in responding to emails,the exams were pretty strait forward,lectures didn't make me want to die,and he was a funny guy.But Sometimes wasn't exactly sure what people were asking him
Wow. This guy is sooo easy and he's really funny. His lecture notes are all you need to look at to get an A in this course. Best.Prof.EVER.
He is a dedicated prof, he'll answer any questions you have, meanwhile keeping the class interesting. You gotta accept his jokes with an open mind, but aside from that he is an excellent prof.
Such a nice guy (he goes out of his way to help students) but his lectures and reading material, to be honest, were kind of boring.
No Comments

very easy teacher!! if you get a hold of past exam he's super easy, almost word for word questions and answer!.... he's very helpful too with the e-mails if you ever need to ask him questions. interesting class too, his lectures are funny with good exampl
No Comments

Great Prof. Very helpful, friendly, and tries to keep the class awake. Ask him any questions u have regarding the class material he'll be happy to answer u in person or via email. Study his lecture notes well and u'll do great in the class.
Amen to the previous comment
not difficult course.the prof is quite enthusiastic in teaching and try to help,but should do more to enhance then enthusiasm of students'
funny guy who does everything he can to help students succeed...I recommend going to every class, *do not* try to rely on lecture tapes
interesting lectures and a good sense of humor.  interesting content.
just read the text book and memorize all the rules that applies... nevermind the prof.  i got a A+ in that class
very helpful, funny guy
download the notes and memorize every single word, don't bother the lecture!
Not a great teacher, annoying sounds.  Accent hinders students understanding.
THE BEST!!!
Easy A but you'll suffer through his lectures about bee dances etc.
This professor won't lend money to his student.
very easy course. all memorization. he has an accent and is kinda werid
interesting
i think it's a good course..  he's not a bad prof..  sorta weird..
Professor is good, and a very easy course - all momory work.
Just MEMORIZE!!!!
Bad jokes. Accent takes effort to understand. Memorization is key to high score.
difficult to understand at times due to accent but otherwise great course
This guy is a hippocrit...he actually THINKS he's funny
Soooo daymn boring!!!! fell asleep almost every class,hard marker!
Pretty easy course, its good that Pank is being very enthusiatic in his teaching
Cheerful fella, and actually uses a students name when answering emails
GPA BOOSTER
his exams are tricky
isn't grammatically correct in his exams
stand up comedy.. that aren't that great
fun course
heavy accent
not responsible
extremely easy exams!!! don't have to study!
a very hard marker for a very easy course
